result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:51 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Richard Ludvik not in court. Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Richard Ludvik.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Kieler is heard on the status of the defendant and his cases. Attorney Kieler comments that the plea and sentencing was moved to 11/21/2022 due to the health of the defendant.  

The plea and sentencing will be held via zoom.  Court approves plea and sentencing via zoom. 
Attorney Kieler is heard, defendant waives his right to attend plea and sentencing in person.  
Attorney Kieler and Defendant will appear via zoom together on 11/21/2022. Attorney Kieler comments that the plea questionnaire will be filled out when he meets with defendant for the plea and sentencing.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:01 AM Defendant Richard C Ludvik appeared by phone.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Richard C Ludvik.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CM53
Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
Defendant plead not guilty. 

22CM37 and 22CM38
Attorney Kieler is heard on the status of the cases.
Jury status hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Richard C. Ludvik appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan Kieler appeared by video for Richard C. Ludvik. 

22CM37 and 22CM38 called together. 

Atty Kieler is heard, defendant will enter a not guilty plea for both cases. Clerk is directed to enter a not guilty plea on both cases. 
Atty Kieler is heard on defendants plans if he were to bond out. Atty Kieler is heard on bond and requests a signature bond. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a cash bond rather than a signature bond.  

22CM37 and 22CM38 - Court orders a signature for each of these two cases. Bond conditions will remain the same for each of these cases.

10:33 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Richard C Ludvik appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22GF141 & 22GF143

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. Corporation counsel has advised that they are looking into arranging things on their end and it may take sometime. 

State recommends the following; bond to be set at a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with AMSN. Court is heard on bond. Court orders bond to be set at a $500.00 cash bond. Defendant shall have no contact with AMSN. No contact with 300 block of South Wacouta Avenue and defendant shall have no contact with the alleyway of the 300 block of South Wacouta Avenue. Defendant shall have no contact with SKJ.
